content.description: Start on a nice boulder problem left of Marge.  Gain a finger crack that pulls through a bulge onto a green face(crux). finish up loose green face and step left at the top to exit.
content.protection: standard light rack. The finish is loose.

content.description:
Climb up a blocky face past gear and one pin to a ledge. Clip a bolt and climb straight up the face to gain the prominent arete and another bolt. Finish up the arete. No anchors on top, belay off gear (Careful-blocky and possibly loose) or tree.

It is slightly run out between the first and second bolt.
content.protection: Standard rack, pin, 2 bolts, No anchors
content.location: The farthest route downstream in the Simpson's area.

climbs.name: Set The Controls For The Heart Of The Sun

content.description: The backside (upstream) side of this formation is a 5.12 top-rope route. Hard finger cracks at the top of this one.
content.location: The far left end of Simpsons wall, on the upstream side of the prominent Ships Prow arete.

content.description: Climb thin finger crack on TR.
content.location: To the right of Crusty, Left of Marge 25'

content.description: The left of two steep parallel crack systems at the left of Simpsons Wall. Start on obvious jutting tusk of rock, and follow broken blocks for a few moves to thin finger crack and up into a handcrack and upper wall split by many flaring cracks.
content.protection: Gear is good, anchors at the top. Small TCUs/Aliens for the lower part and a few hand size pieces for the upper.

content.description: Start in the left crack from Barts Crack. Move up and left away from roof towards a pine tree.

content.protection: Standard rack. No Anchors.  Great tree up and left over Bart for belay.
content.location: 10' to right of Bart, in corner.  Climb nice 25' Corner to dirty ledges.  Exit L to large tree above Bart.

content.description: Starts out with wide left facing crack up to nice double tiered roof.
content.location: 5 yards right of Lisa's Crack. on ledge.

content.description: The right of the two overhanging start crack climbs at the left of Simpsons. May need a rock to stand on to start. Reach up and grab good ledge, go up through crack system and blocks.
content.protection: Build and anchor off the trees at the top, no shuts. An extra .75 came in handy for a friend in addition to a normal rack.

content.description: The classic Simpson's wall sandbag.  This is a boulder problem.  Start on the left facing horn on a large detached flake under the cliff.  Traverse right under the 8' roof for 8' then complete the problem by hanging on large jugs under the slab that is between Marge and Mr. Burns.
content.protection: Pad is nice, but problem is low.
content.location: It starts on a left facing horn at the far left side of the cave to the left of Marge.  It is just right and under Mr. Burns.

content.description: Climb steep rock to gain crack.  Climb hand crack to small roof (crux).  Pull roof and finish up fun crusty face above.  belay from trees at top.
content.location: Route starts about 25' downstream from Marge.

content.description: Start in the chunky corner right of Homer and Marge. Move up and left under a small roof, pull the roof and continue to the top
content.protection: Standard rack, trees for anchors, no bolts

content.description: Start right of Barts Crack in small left corner and follow crack, flakes and blocks to the top, finish same as Barts Crack
